verses.text: And it came to pass in the fourth year of king Darius, \add that\add* the word of the \sc Lord\sc* came unto Zechariah in the fourth \add day\add* of the ninth month, \add even\add* in Chisleu;
when they had sent \add unto\add* the house of God Sherezer and Regem-melech, and their men, to pray before the \sc Lord\sc*,

\add and\add* to speak unto the priests which \add were\add* in the house of the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, and to the prophets, saying, Should I weep in the fifth month, separating myself, as I have done these so many years?
Then came the word of the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts unto me, saying,

Speak unto all the people of the land, and to the priests, saying, When ye fasted and mourned in the fifth and seventh \add month\add*, even those seventy years, did ye at all fast \add unto\add* me, \add even to\add* me?
And when ye did eat, and when ye did drink, did not ye eat \add for yourselves\add*, and drink \add for yourselves?\add*

\add Should ye\add* not \add hear\add* the words which the \sc Lord\sc* hath cried by the former prophets, when Jerusalem was inhabited and in prosperity, and the cities thereof round about her, when \add men\add* inhabited the south and the plain?
And the word of the \sc Lord\sc* came unto Zechariah, saying,
Thus speaketh the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, saying, Execute true judgment, And shew mercy and compassions every man to his brother:
And oppress not the widow, nor the fatherless, the stranger, nor the poor; And let none of you imagine evil against his brother in your heart.
But they refused to hearken, and pulled away the shoulder, And stopped their ears, that \add they\add* should not hear.

Yea, they made their hearts \add as\add* an adamant stone, lest \add they\add* should hear the law, And the words which the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts hath sent in his spirit by the former prophets: Therefore came a great wrath from the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts.
Therefore it is come to pass, \add that\add* as he cried, and they would not hear; So they cried, and I would not hear, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts:

But I scattered them with a whirlwind among all the nations whom they knew not: Thus the land was desolate after them, that no man passed through nor returned: For they laid the pleasant land desolate.
